title: Newcastle Jet top scorer Deven Jackson joins Melbourne City | Newcastle Herald
body_text:
New Zealand international Deven Jackson has left the Newcastle Jets to join A-League Women's heavyweights Melbourne City.
Subscribe now for unlimited access.
or signup to continue reading
Two hours after the Jets announced last season's joint leading scorer had departed, the 2024-25 premiers revealed they had signed the 27-year-old.
"Joining a club like Melbourne City is a massive opportunity and one I'm incredibly excited for," Jackson said in a statement released by City.
"I've heard so many positive things about the club's culture, facilities and professionalism, and I'm really looking forward to being part of such a strong and ambitious group.
"I'm ready to get to work, meet the team, and do everything I can to help bring more success to City in both the A-League Women's and AFC Women's Champions League."
City secured their place in another AFC Women's Champions League after being unbeaten on their way to a third consecutive premiership.
Their squad is brimming with talent and experience, including Jackson's compatriot Rebekah Stott plus Matildas Holly McNamara, Leah Davidson and Laura Hughes.
Jackson joined the Jets from her home base of Melbourne last season on a one-year contract.
She made 18 appearances, scoring six goals to be jointly awarded the club's golden boot accolade with dual-code talent Sheridan Gallagher.
She was sidelined for seven weeks after sustaining multiple facial fractures in a head clash against Wellington Phoenix in January.
Jackson has been back in Melbourne, playing for Essendon Royals in NPLW Victoria during the A-League off-season.
"So grateful for my time in Newcastle - I owe it all to the club, the staff, the girls, the community and of course the beaches (& baths)," Jackson posted to Instagram.
"Will miss the Newy lifestyle but excited to play at home."
The news comes two weeks after the Jets revealed strike weapon Melina Ayres would be back this campaign after taking a season off.
Ayres' return is a major boost as Newcastle eye a return to finals after a disappointing 2024-25 campaign. While Jackson and Gallagher scored six goals each, the Jets lacked an out-and-out lead striker.
Jackson joins a long list of departures from last season's squad, most prominent are Gallagher, Swiss defender Lorena Baumann, Canadian goalkeeper Danielle Krzyzaniak and Young Matildas representative Lara Gooch.
New coach Stephen Hoyle, who has replaced Ryan Campbell, has signed goalkeeper Anna Leat, a New Zealand international.
Home-grown captain Cassidy Davis has been re-signed for a 13th campaign and is eyeing 200 appearances for the Jets.
Jets academy products Josie Allan and Claire Adams have been upgraded from scholarship players to the top roster.
Already contracted for another year were Matildas centre-back Natasha Prior, Jets player of the year Sophie Hoban, attacker India Breier, defenders Josie Wilson and Claudia Cicco plus home-grown midfielders Emma Dundas and Libby Copus-Brown.
After breaking a six-year drought to make finals in 2023-24, the Jets finished a disappointing second-last in 2024-25
The A-League Women's season is set to start on October 31. The Jets' first hit-out under new coach Stephen Hoyle will be against a Northern NSW Football All-Stars side at Darling Street Oval on September 20.
Meanwhile, the Jets will be minus Ben Gibson for a men's Australia Cup semi-final against Avondale in Melbourne on Sunday with the forward away on representative duties overseas.
Earlier this week the 22-year-old was named in the Olyroos squad, travelling to Saudi Arabia for AFC Under-23 Asian Cup qualifiers which take place from September 1 to 9.
